org.itemscript.core.connectors
Class MemConnector

java.lang.Object
  org.itemscript.core.connectors.ConnectorBase
      org.itemscript.core.connectors.MemConnector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Connector, SyncBrowseConnector, SyncDumpConnector, SyncGetConnector, SyncLoadConnector, SyncPostConnector, SyncPutConnector, HasSystem
public final class MemConnector
extends ConnectorBase
implements SyncGetConnector, SyncPutConnector, SyncBrowseConnector, SyncDumpConnector, SyncLoadConnector, SyncPostConnector

Implements the in-memory item store.

Author:
Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

Method Detail

create

public static JsonObject create(JsonSystem system)
Create the MemConnector for an JsonSystem. This initializes the system and returns the JsonObject from the location "mem:/itemscript/connectors" that is used to store the Connector objects for the system.

Parameters:
system - The associated JsonSystem.
Returns:
The JsonObject from the location "mem:/itemscript/connectors".

countItems

public JsonObject countItems(Url url)
Description copied from interface: SyncBrowseConnector
Called when the query contains the "countItems" key. It must return a JsonObject with a "count" field with an integer value corresponding to the number of sub-items of the item given by the URL path, like this: 
 {
     "count" : 1000000
 }
Connectors that cannot return a count of sub-items should return a JsonObject exactly like this: 
 {
     "countType":"unknown",
     "count" : -1
 }
Connectors that cannot return an accurate count of sub-items but can return an approximate number should return a JsonObject looking like this: 
 {
     "countType":"approximate",
     "count":1000000
 }
where 1000000 should be a JsonNumber with the approximate number of sub-items.

Specified by:
countItems in interface SyncBrowseConnector
Parameters:
url - The URL to query.
Returns:
A JsonNumber with the count of sub-items, or a JsonObject as above.

dump

public JsonObject dump(Url url)
Description copied from interface: SyncDumpConnector
Dump the value at the given URL to a JsonObject.

The returned object will contain two keys. Under the key "value" will be the JsonValue associated with the item that was dumped. Under the key "subItems" will be a JsonObject. In that object, each key will the key of a sub-item of the dumped item, and each corresponding value will be the dumped value of that sub-item.

For instance: 

 system.put("/foo", 1);
 system.put("/foo/a", 2);
 system.put("/foo/a/x", true);
 system.put("/foo/b", 3);
 System.out.println(system.get("/foo?dump"));
prints: 
 {
     "subItems" : {
         "b" : {
              "subItems" : {},
              "value" : 3
         },
         "a" : {
             "subItems" : {
                 "x" : {
                     "subItems" : {},
                     "value" : true
                 }
             },
             "value" : 2
         }
     },
     "value" : 1
 }

Specified by:
dump in interface SyncDumpConnector
Parameters:
url - The URL to dump.
Returns:
The JsonObject corresponding to the dumped contents of that value.
See Also:
SyncLoadConnector.load(org.itemscript.core.url.Url, org.itemscript.core.values.JsonObject)

getKeys

public JsonArray getKeys(Url url)
Description copied from interface: SyncBrowseConnector
Called when the query contains the "keys" key. It must return a JsonArray containing the keys for the sub-items of the item given by the URL path as JsonStrings. Connectors that cannot return a full list of keys should return a single page of keys, as if SyncBrowseConnector.pagedKeys(org.itemscript.core.url.Url) was called without specifying a start row or number of rows to return.

Specified by:
getKeys in interface SyncBrowseConnector
Parameters:
url - The URL to query.
Returns:
A JsonArray with the keys of sub-items as JsonStrings.

pagedItems

public JsonArray pagedItems(Url url)
Description copied from interface: SyncBrowseConnector
Called when the query contains the "pagedItems" key. It must return a JsonArray in which each element is a JsonObject with two entries: under "key" will be the key of the sub-item; under "value" is the actual JsonValue of the sub-item. It may also return a JsonObject under "meta" containing metadata about the results. For instance: 
 [
     {
         "key" : "one",
         "value" : {
             "actual":"value"
         }
     },
     {
         "key" : "two",
         "value" : {
             "another":"value"
         }
     }
 ]
Sorting and paging keys in the query will be used to determine the ordering and number of results, as with the SyncBrowseConnector.pagedKeys(org.itemscript.core.url.Url) method. The sorting of the results should be alphabetically by key, or failing that, any other deterministic method of sorting.

Specified by:
pagedItems in interface SyncBrowseConnector
Parameters:
url - The URL to query.
Returns:
A JsonArray with contents as specified above.

pagedKeys

public JsonArray pagedKeys(Url url)
Description copied from interface: SyncBrowseConnector
Called when the query contains the "pagedKeys" key. It must return a JsonArray in which each entry is a JsonString containing the key of a sub-item of the item pointed to by the URL. The following keys, if present, control the paging and ordering behavior of the query:
  • "startRow" - The row to begin the page of keys, where 0 would be the first row.
  • "numRows" - The number of rows to return in the page of keys.
  • "orderBy" - The path to the field in the value of the sub-items to order by. This must have a scalar value, not a container value. The ordering of sub-items whose values are not objects or which are objects without the given field or where the field is a container value is undefined. The path must consist of a key or a series of URL-encoded keys separated by slashes.
  • "ascending" - With a value of "true" or "false", whether to sort results in ascending or descending order.
If "orderBy" is not present, results should be sorted by key name, or failing that, by any other deterministic method appropriate to the system.

Specified by:
pagedKeys in interface SyncBrowseConnector
Parameters:
url - The URL to query.
Returns:
A JsonArray containing JsonStrings giving the keys of sub-items.
